Key Match Events: The Dodgers won the game in 10 innings with a score of 6-2.
Mookie Betts hit a home run on the first pitch he saw from reliever Roansy Contreras.
Shohei Ohtani was intentionally walked in the top of the 10th inning, and the Angels chose to pitch to Mookie Betts instead.
Ohtani finished the night 1-for-4 with a triple, a walk, two runs scored, and one RBI.
Pre-Game Insights: The 44,731 fans in attendance for the first of two games between the Dodgers and Angels on Tuesday showed their appreciation for Shohei Ohtani with a standing ovation before his first at-bat.
The crowd erupted with 'MVP' chants as Ohtani reached third base after ripping a line drive down the right-field line in the seventh inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani said that the biggest part of his return to Angel Stadium was being able to play in front of the Anaheim fans.
Angels manager Ron Washington explained that he intentionally walked Ohtani in the top of the 10th inning to avoid pitching to him with a runner on first and a 3-2 lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers held the best record in the National League and a 5Â½-game lead over the Padres, putting Ohtani on the brink of his first MLB postseason.
The Angels spent a total of 64 days (including off-days) in first place in the American League West from 2018-23 with Ohtani.
Others: The video board operator at Angel Stadium displayed 'Used to work here' under Shohei Ohtani's name during the fifth inning, a lighthearted jab at Ohtani's return to Anaheim.
